fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Interface DataInboundPortI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, DataOfferedI.PullI, DataOfferedI.PushI, InboundPortI, OfferedI, PortI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataInboundPort, AbstractDataInboundPortForPlugin, PairDataInboundPort, PingPongDataInboundPort

    public interface DataInboundPortI
extends InboundPortI, DataOfferedI.PullI, DataOfferedI.PushI
    The interface DataInboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than being called for their services.

    Description

    An inbound port is associated with a BasicDataOfferedI interface used to implement a basic interface to get data from a provider component. The primary way to get the data is the pull mode, where the client component calls the provider through the get() method which returns a piece of data. But the port can also be used in a push mode where the provider delivers the data to the client by calling a send method with a piece of data as parameter.

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
